tickets-are-live.content: Our ticket schedule is now live on Eventbrite! We are doing three ticket releases, and the first one will be on October 27th. Do not miss out!
tickets-are-live.title: Tickets are live!

call-for-speakers-open.brief: Our submission form for speakers is officially open! Please send us your proposal today.
call-for-speakers-open.content:
GDG Glasgow is proud to announce that the submission form for speakers is open! We have created a short form on Sessionize and invite you to fill it out to get a chance to speak at our DevFest this November. We welcome any topics. We want speakers that are passionate, that can grab the attention of the audience right away and hold it until the end, and leave them wanting more. Please note: the call for speakers form closes on the 31st of October, 2018.
Submit a proposal
call-for-speakers-open.title: Speaker form open!

c4p.brief: We are looking for speakers for GDG DevFest Glasgow
c4p.content:
We are looking for speakers for GDG DevFest Glasgow. Our focus is the content. **We’re looking for speakers like you**, who are ready to rock the stage and deliver the best talk or workshop in the field.  

Why is it cool to speak at the DevFest? You will get to interact with an incredible audience hungry to learn, network with others, enjoy the lovely city of Glasgow, and work on yourself. Our form is not yet open but will be soon. If you would like to contact us for more information or submit a talk to discuss it, our email is [gdgglasgow@gmail.com](mailto:gdgglasgow@gmail.com).
c4p.title: We're looking for speakers

dfua18-announced.brief: GDG Glasgow has begun planning DevFest 2018!.
dfua18-announced.content: It is official. GDG DevFest Glasgow 2018 is in motion. We do not have any details yet but will update this page as well as our social media once we confirm everything. Follow us on [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/gdgglasgow/) and join [Meetup](https://www.meetup.com/Glasgow-New-Technology-Meetup/) to keep up with announcements and conference updates.
dfua18-announced.title: Announcing GDG DevFest Glasgow 2018

thank-you.brief: Our team wants to thank our speakers, attendees, and partners who made GDG DevFest Glasgow 2017 possible
thank-you.content: We want to thank one more time our partners, who made [DevFest 2017](https://df17.gdg-glasgow.com/) possible! THANK YOU for being creative and motivating our participants, THANK YOU for your workshops and expertise. Again, THANK YOU all, you are amazing! Hope you join us next year! With love, GDG Glasgow Team
thank-you.title: Thank you all for your support

swav_kulinski.bio: Swav is a Flutter GDE (Google Developer Expert) and the lead of Android Community of Practice at The App Business which he has grown from start. For the last two years he have been promoting Flutter within the business and outside with his clients. Swav shares all his knowledge from commercial and non commercial development in blog posts. He strongly believe that Flutter has the massive potential to become a mainstream mobile app platform and will make the developer community better as it is more affordable and is quite a pleasure to learn.
swav_kulinski.name: Swav Kulinski
swav_kulinski.shortBio: Swav is a Flutter GDE and is the lead of Android Community of Practice at The App Business.
swav_kulinski.title: Flutter GDE, Lead Android Developer at The App Business

doug_sillars.bio:
Doug is a leading mobile performance developer advocate and evangelist. Doug has worked with thousands of developers around the world, helping them improve the speed, battery life and customer satisfaction of their mobile applications (both native and web). The author of O'Reilly's 'High Performance Android Apps,' he has spoken at conferences around the world on mobile performance.

He is currently freelancing, and traveling with his family of 6 (plus the dog!) as a digital nomad in Europe.
doug_sillars.name: Doug Sillars
doug_sillars.shortBio: Doug is a leading mobile performance developer advocate and evangelist.
doug_sillars.title: Freelance Performance Expert

amanda_cavallaro.bio: Amanda Cavallaro is a software developer and is passionate about Cloud technologies, Human Computer Interactions, and conversational apps. She works at resolver.co.uk and is a Women Techmakers Lead and Community Organiser at Google Developer Group Cloud London. You can speak to her in Portuguese, English, Italian and a little of Japanese.
amanda_cavallaro.name: Amanda Cavallaro
amanda_cavallaro.shortBio: Amanda Cavallaro is a software developer, passionate about Cloud technologies, Human Computer Interactions, and conversational apps
amanda_cavallaro.title: Co-Organizer GDG London

martin_hawksey.bio:
Martin has held advisory roles within the UK educational technology sector for a number of government-funded services. In these roles, he has supported staff in the exploration and adoption of innovative approaches to teaching and learning. Martin was also an early adopter of Google Apps Script and this tool regularly features in the solutions he publishes and often integrates with other Google products, such as Google Maps, Google Charts and Google Analytics.

As Chief Innovation, Technology and Community Officer at the Association for Learning Technology (ALT) his work continues to focus on how Google services can be used to support the development of ALT's member community.
martin_hawksey.name: Martin Hawksey
martin_hawksey.shortBio: Martin has held advisory roles within the UK educational technology sector for a number of government-funded services
martin_hawksey.title: GDE Google Apps Script and Chief Innovation, Technology and Community Officer at the Association for Learning Technology

jimmy_huguet.bio: Jimmy started his code journey during high school. He learned C++ on his free time and oriented his career towards programming. He worked with the Qt framework for many years in different companies before joining OBASHI where he learned golang.
jimmy_huguet.name: Jimmy Huguet
jimmy_huguet.shortBio: Jimmy is one of the main software engineers at OBASHI.
jimmy_huguet.title: Software engineer at OBASHI
